result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephen M Reid was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.

Fine and costs shall be paid at the rate of $50 per month commencing April 15, 2016 and by the 15th of each month thereafter or judgment shall enter for nonpayment.    There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Stephen M Reid

records.addlTxt: Sent copy via email of Complaint, JOC & Plea questionnaire to Wis Dept of Justice CIB per request recd 7-13-18
Copy of complaint, judgment of conviction, and plea agreement emailed to CIB per request rec'd 6/7/18
Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Def in person & by Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Atty Mandy A. Schepper appeared for State. ON a plea to Ct. 2, State moves to dismiss and read in Ct. 1;   No contest plea entered on Ct. 2; Colloquy w/ defendant;  Court finds def guilty on Ct. 2, on motion of the state dismisses Ct. 1 for read in, enters judgment of conviction;   Court imposes a fine of $642 to be paid at a rate of $50 per month commencing 4/15/16  or judgment shall be entered for nonpayment.  Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Jail for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.   Court informs Defendant of DNA expungement rights.   There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.
Atty Alyssa Armbrust appearing for Def.  Atty Mark David Bensen for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 16, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Victim does not request to be present for hearings

Def in person & by Atty Alyssa Armbrust.  Atty Mark D. Bensen appeared for State.  Clerk: EZ.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Court orders $250.00 signature bond.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 3, 2016 at 08:15 am.
